BETA Program Presentation

Here is an example of how to present piece of a BETA program, using <BETA>.
that the program below will only show background color, border and indentation in CSS aware browsers. For instance not in netscape 3.0. ORIGIN '~beta/basiclib/betaenv'; (* The classical "Hello, World" program in BETA *) --PROGRAM: descriptor-- (# do 'Hello, World!' -> Screen.PutLine; 'Goodbye, World!' -> Screen.PutLine; #)

For other more elaborate examples of using the <BETA> tag, see doc/admin/makedoc.html#beta.

Here is another example, where focus is on the fragment structure. It uses a table with class=beta, and the code inside <TD> is set with <PRE> (and not class=beta!). This is necessary to make it look reasonable in non-CSS aware browsers, like Netscape 3.0.

fragment.bet

NAME 'textlib'
ORIGIN 'betaenv'
INCLUDE 'mylib'
LIB: attributes
SpreadText:
  (* A blank is inserted between all chars in the text 'T' *)
  (# T: @text
  enter T
  <<SLOT SpreadText:DoPart>>
  exit T
  #);
BreakIntoLines:
  (* 'T' refers to a text which is to be split into lines. *)
  (* 'w' is the width of the lines. *)
  (# T: ^ Text; w: @ Integer
  enter(T[],w)
  <<SLOT BreakIntoLines: DoPart>>
  #)
